item.title: 日本央行调查显示工资增长在日本中小型企业中蔓延
item.description: 日本央行周五的一项调查显示，今年日本中小型企业提高工资的势头正在蔓延，这反映了劳动力短缺以及企业为帮助员工应对通胀挤压所做的努力。【原文：Momentum to raise wages has been spreading among small and medium firms in Japan this year, reflecting labour shortages and efforts to help employees tackle an inflationary squeeze, a central bank survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 英特尔公司高管表示，到 2027 年底，软件累计销售额有望达到 10 亿美元
item.description: 英特尔首席技术官格雷格-拉文德（Greg Lavender）告诉路透社，英特尔在软件领域的推进进展顺利，到 2027 年底，该公司的累计软件收入将达到 10 亿美元。【原文：Intel's push into software is going well and the company could have cumulative software revenue of $1 billion by the end of 2027, Chief Technology Officer Greg Lavender told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国央行周一将维持中期贷款利率稳定
item.description: 路透社的一项调查显示，人们普遍预计中国央行将维持中期利率不变，并在周一展期此类到期贷款时从银行系统中抽走一些现金。【原文：China's central bank is widely expected to leave a medium-term interest rate unchanged and drain some cash from the banking system when rolling over such maturing loans on Monday, a Reuters survey showed.】

item.title: 避之不及的英国市场成为全球风暴的避风港
item.description: 随着美国和欧洲其他地区政治不确定性的上升，投资者正将英国市场视为潜在的避风港，这可能标志着一个似乎已失去对全球资本传统吸引力的国家的惊人转变。【原文：Investors are looking at UK markets as a potential haven as political uncertainty rises in the U.S. and elsewhere in Europe, in what could mark a stunning turnaround for a country that appeared to have lost its traditional appeal to global capital.】

item.title: 季度调查显示，日本家庭通胀预期增强
item.description: 周五，日本央行的一项季度调查显示，近90%的日本家庭预计一年后物价将上涨，这是通胀预期升温的一个迹象，有助于为近期加息提供依据。【原文：Nearly 90% of Japanese households expect prices to rise a year from now, a quarterly central bank survey showed on Friday, a sign of heightening inflation expectations that would help make the case for a near-term interest rate hike.】

item.title: 早间竞标东京的干预艺术
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: VIEW 中国 6 月原油和未锻轧铜进口量同比下降
item.description: 周五的海关数据显示，中国 6 月份的大豆、煤炭和铁矿石进口量环比增长，而原油、未锻造铜和稀土的进口量则有所下降。【原文：China's imports of soybeans, coal and iron ore in June rose from a year earlier, while those of crude oil, unwrought copper and rare earths fell, customs data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 特斯拉推出新款 Model 3 长程版，网站显示售价 42,490 美元
item.description: 据电动汽车制造商特斯拉网站报道，特斯拉周四推出了新款后轮驱动型 Model 3 长程汽车，价格比全轮驱动型低 5000 美元。【原文：Tesla on Thursday launched a new rear-wheel drive variant of its Model 3 long-range vehicle, at a price $5,000 lower than the all-wheel drive version, according to the electric vehicle maker's website.】

item.title: 中国出口增长，但进口下降抑制了 6 月贸易数据
item.description: 周五的海关数据显示，中国 6 月份出口同比增长 8.6%，进口意外萎缩 2.3%，这表明制造商正在提前下订单，以应对越来越多贸易伙伴的关税。【原文：China's exports rose 8.6% in June from a year earlier, and imports unexpectedly shrank 2.3%, customs data showed on Friday, suggesting manufacturers are front-loading orders in anticipation of tariffs from a growing number of trade partners.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳新银行首席执行官告诉员工将调查虚高债券交易的指控
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团首席执行官在给员工的一封电子邮件中说，该集团计划 "查清 "对其债券交易业务不当行为的指控，并将追究任何不当行为的责任。【原文：Australia's ANZ Group plans to "get to the bottom" of allegations of misconduct that have been raised against its bond trading operations and will hold people accountable for any wrongdoing, its CEO said in an email to staff.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社称，波音公司警告客户 737 Max 将进一步推迟生产
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，波音公司最近几周已通知一些737 Max客户，定于2025年和2026年交付的飞机可能会面临3至6个月的额外延期。【原文：Boeing has notified some 737 Max customers in recent weeks that aircraft due for delivery in 2025 and 2026 might face additional delays of three to six months, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 干预神经紧张，日元走势波澜不惊；亚洲股市瞩目本周涨幅
item.description: 周五，日元在震荡交易中涨跌互现，反映出投资者在美国通胀报告低于预期后认为东京已采取干预措施支撑日元后的恐慌情绪。【原文：The yen swung between losses and gains on Friday in volatile trade, reflecting investors' skittishness after Tokyo was thought to have intervened to prop up the Japanese currency in the wake of a cooler-than-expected U.S. inflation report.】

item.title: 中国无情的电商价格战让卖家入不敷出
item.description: 随着销售增长放缓、价格压力增大，以及购物平台为吸引越来越注重成本的客户而采取越来越激进的政策，中国的电子商务供应商正在为生存而挣扎。【原文：Chinese e-commerce vendors are struggling for survival as sales growth slows, price pressure rises and shopping platforms compete with ever-more aggressive policies to attract increasingly cost-conscious customers.】

item.title: 韩亚货运采购后仁川航空考虑订购宽体货机
item.description: 仁川航空首席执行官表示，一旦收购韩亚航空货运部门的交易敲定，仁川航空将成为韩国第二大货运航空公司，该公司将考虑采用波音和空客货机来更新宽体机机队。【原文：Air Incheon, set to become South Korea's second-biggest freight carrier once a deal to buy Asiana Airlines' cargo unit is finalised, will consider both Boeing and Airbus freighters to refresh the widebody fleet, its CEO said.】

item.title: 出生率下降，日本纸尿裤制造商寻求成人市场创收
item.description: 日本一家工厂里的大型金属臂将一簇簇蓬松的白色长方形布料从旋转台上扫下，放入一组布料中，然后用塑料包装起来，准备装运。【原文：A large metal arm in a Japanese factory swept a cluster of fluffy white fabric rectangles off a carousel into a group to be wrapped in plastic before packaging for shipment.】

item.title: 美国通胀降温，夏季需求强劲，石油上涨
item.description: 周五亚洲交易时段早盘，油价上涨，因为有迹象表明夏季需求强劲，全球最大的石油市场美国的通胀压力有所缓解，这增强了投资者的信心。【原文：Oil prices rose in early Asian trading hours on Friday as signs of strong summer demand and easing inflationary pressures in the world's biggest oil market, the United States, bolstered investor confidence.】

item.title: 日元波动令汇市紧张不安
item.description: 由于美国 6 月份消费者物价意外下降，日元在前一交易日大幅飙升，引发了市场对东京采取干预措施使日元脱离 38 年低点的猜测，周五日元汇率波动剧烈。【原文：The yen was volatile on Friday after a sharp surge in the previous session in the wake of U.S. consumer prices unexpectedly dropping in June, stoking speculation that Tokyo had intervened to lift the currency away from 38-year lows.】

item.title: 日本最高外汇外交官称当局将根据需要对日元采取行动
item.description: 日本最高货币外交官神田雅人（Masato Kanda）周五表示，在日元隔夜飙升引发市场对货币干预的猜测之后，日本当局将在外汇市场采取必要的行动。【原文：Japan's top currency diplomat, Masato Kanda, said on Friday authorities will take action as needed in the foreign exchange market, after the yen's spike overnight raised market speculation about currency intervention.】

item.title: 北约峰会强调 RTX、波音等公司的防务交易
item.description: 在华盛顿举行的北约峰会为美国顶级防务公司和其他公司展示了一系列重大交易，包括 RTX 公司、洛克希德-马丁公司、波音公司、挪威康斯伯格防务公司和瑞典萨博公司。【原文：The NATO summit in Washington showcased a series of significant deals for top U.S. defense companies and others, including RTX , Lockheed Martin , Boeing , Norway's Kongsberg Defense and Sweden's SAAB .】

item.title: Rho Motion称，6月份全球电动汽车销量增长13%，欧洲下降7
item.description: 市场研究公司 Rho Motion 称，受中国增长的推动，6 月份全电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车的全球销量与 2023 年同期相比增长了 13%，而欧洲的销量则有所下降。【原文：Global sales of fully electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles rose by 13% in June versus the same month in 2023 driven by growth in China, while they dropped in Europe, market research firm Rho Motion said.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，UAW 因担心特朗普可能击败拜登而考虑下一步行动
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士称，美国汽车工人联合会主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）周四晚些时候会见了工会执行董事会，讨论了他对乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统能否在 11 月大选中击败唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的深切担忧。【原文：United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain met with the union's executive board late on Thursday to discuss his deep concerns with President Joe Biden's ability to defeat Donald Trump in the November election, three sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 雅诗兰黛称首席财务官特拉维斯将在 12 年后离职
item.description: 雅诗兰黛（Estee Lauder）周四表示，特蕾西-特拉维斯（Tracey Travis）将于 2025 年 6 月 30 日卸任，从她担任了 12 年的 MAC 口红生产商财务总监的岗位上退休。【原文：Estee Lauder said on Thursday that Tracey Travis would be stepping down and retiring from her 12 years role as the MAC lipstick maker's finance chief, effective June 30, 2025.】

item.title: 亚洲日元反弹：CPI利空还是干预？
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国因 "未审查 "海上石油退役延迟造成的 "危害 "而被起诉
item.description: 一个环保组织周四起诉美国政府，指控其审查老化的海上石油和天然气基础设施所造成危害的方法，称延迟退役会给人类和环境带来风险。【原文：An environmental group on Thursday sued the U.S. government over its approach to examining the harm caused by ageing offshore oil and gas infrastructure, citing the risks delayed decommissioning poses to people and the environment.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比通往 2% 通胀率的道路是这样的
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四表示，美国经济在今年早些时候经历了一次上扬之后，似乎又回到了通胀率达到 2% 的轨道上。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee said on Thursday the U.S. economy looks like it is back on track to 2% inflation after a bump up earlier this year, a view that suggests he is gaining confidence that the time will soon be ripe to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 在美国和解协议中，Dollar General 将支付 1200 万美元罚款，并改善安全状况
item.description: 美国政府周四在一份声明中表示，折扣店运营商 Dollar General 因涉嫌违反安全规定导致出口和灭火器堵塞以及储藏不安全而同意支付 1200 万美元的罚款，要求该公司在与联邦劳工部达成的和解协议中改善全美商店的工作场所安全。【原文：Discount store operator Dollar General has agreed to pay $12 million in penalty for alleged safety violations that led to blocked exits and fire extinguishers and unsafe storage, requiring the company to improve workplace safety in stores across the U.S. in a settlement with the federal Labor Department, the government said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 公司推出基于掉期交易的比特币 ETF 期权
item.description: 周四，刚刚推出的通过衍生品掉期跟踪比特币现货价格的杠杆产品期权开始交易，这在加密货币交易所交易基金（ETF）领域尚属首次。【原文：Options on just-launched leveraged products that track the spot price of bitcoin via derivative swaps began trading on Thursday, a first for the cryptocurrency exchange-traded fund (ETF) universe.】

item.title: 消息人士称，波音即将达成向大韩航空出售 777X 喷气式飞机的协议
item.description: 业内消息人士称，波音公司即将向大韩航空出售约二十多架 777X 喷气式飞机，交易金额约为 40 亿至 60 亿美元，最早可能在 7 月份的范堡罗航展上敲定。【原文：Boeing is nearing a potential sale of some two dozen 777X jets to Korean Air in a roughly $4 billion to $6 billion deal that could be finalised as early as July's Farnborough Airshow, industry sources said.】

item.title: 智利锂业将有资格享受美国税收优惠
item.description: 智利政府周四表示，使用智利开采的电动汽车电池用锂制造的产品将有资格享受美国的税收优惠。【原文：Products made with Chilean-mined lithium - used for electric-vehicle batteries - will be eligible for U.S. tax benefits, the Andean country's government said on Thursday.】

item.title: 日历变动后，美国 6 月预算赤字缩减至 660 亿美元
item.description: 美国财政部周四表示，美国政府 6 月份录得 660 亿美元的预算赤字，但由于将福利金支付转入 5 月份，导致该月赤字激增至 3,470 亿美元，从而大幅减少了预算赤字。【原文：The U.S. government recorded a $66 billion budget deficit for June that was reduced sharply by a shift of benefit payments into May that ballooned that month's deficit to $347 billion, the Treasury Department said on Thursday.】
